title: N.C. Law Strikes A Balance Between Same-Sex Marriages And Religious Freedom
teaser: As supporters of marriage equality celebrate the Supreme Court's ruling, opponents of same-sex unions are considering how to proceed. Some conservatives say legislation is one way to balance religious liberties with equal protections. And a new law in North Carolina could serve as a model moving forward.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
